help.title: How to Use Running Calculator
help.intro: The Running Calculator helps you calculate distance, time, and pace for your runs. You can use it in two ways: manual calculation or automatic calculation with the lock feature.
help.manualSteps: Fill in any two fields and click the calculate button next to the third field:
help.distanceCalcDesc: Enter time and pace, then click the distance calculate button
help.timeCalcDesc: Enter distance and pace, then click the time calculate button
help.paceCalcDesc: Enter distance and time, then click the pace calculate button
help.lockDescription: The lock feature allows automatic calculation as you type. When you lock a field, it becomes constant and other fields are calculated automatically.
help.step1: Click the lock icon next to any field to lock it
help.step2: The locked field becomes constant (shown with a filled lock icon)
help.step3: Type values in the other fields - calculations happen instantly!
help.lockProtection: Locked fields are protected and visually disabled
help.lockProtectionDesc: You can only lock fields with values. Locked fields appear grayed out and cannot be edited. Associated chips are also disabled. The lock is automatically released if the field becomes empty.
help.lockDistanceDesc: Distance stays constant. Change time or pace to calculate the other.
help.lockTimeDesc: Time stays constant. Change distance or pace to calculate the other.
help.lockPaceDesc: Pace stays constant. Change distance or time to calculate the other.
help.timeFormatsDesc: The calculator supports multiple time formats:
help.preciseTimeNote: Enable "Precise time" mode to use tenths of seconds in calculations.
help.tip1: Use the lock feature for quick "what-if" scenarios - lock your target pace and see how distance affects time.
help.tip2: Only one field can be locked at a time. Locking a new field automatically unlocks the previous one.
help.tip3: The Speed ↔ Pace Converter at the bottom helps convert between different pace and speed units.
help.tip4: Switch between metric and imperial units in the settings to match your preference.
